title: Google\Cloud\CloudDms\V1\CloudSqlSettings
name: CloudSqlSettings
description:
Settings for creating a Cloud SQL database instance.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.clouddms.v1.CloudSqlSettings

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.database_version
params.description: The database engine type and version.

params.name: data.user_labels
params.description: The resource labels for a Cloud SQL instance to use to annotate any related underlying resources such as Compute Engine VMs. An object containing a list of "key": "value" pairs. Example: { "name": "wrench", "mass": "18kg", "count": "3" }.

params.name: data.tier
params.description: The tier (or machine type) for this instance, for example: db-n1-standard-1 (MySQL instances) or db-custom-1-3840 (PostgreSQL instances). For more information, see Cloud SQL Instance Settings.

params.name: data.storage_auto_resize_limit
params.description: The maximum size to which storage capacity can be automatically increased. The default value is 0, which specifies that there is no limit.

params.name: data.activation_policy
params.description: The activation policy specifies when the instance is activated; it is applicable only when the instance state is 'RUNNABLE'. Valid values: 'ALWAYS': The instance is on, and remains so even in the absence of connection requests. NEVER: The instance is off; it is not activated, even if a connection request arrives.

params.name: data.ip_config
params.description: The settings for IP Management. This allows to enable or disable the instance IP and manage which external networks can connect to the instance. The IPv4 address cannot be disabled.

params.name: data.auto_storage_increase
params.description: [default: ON] If you enable this setting, Cloud SQL checks your available storage every 30 seconds. If the available storage falls below a threshold size, Cloud SQL automatically adds additional storage capacity. If the available storage repeatedly falls below the threshold size, Cloud SQL continues to add storage until it reaches the maximum of 30 TB.

params.name: data.database_flags
params.description: The database flags passed to the Cloud SQL instance at startup. An object containing a list of "key": value pairs. Example: { "name": "wrench", "mass": "1.3kg", "count": "3" }.

params.name: data.data_disk_type
params.description: The type of storage: PD_SSD (default) or PD_HDD.

params.name: data.data_disk_size_gb
params.description: The storage capacity available to the database, in GB. The minimum (and default) size is 10GB.

params.name: data.zone
params.description: The Google Cloud Platform zone where your Cloud SQL datdabse instance is located.

params.name: data.source_id
params.description: The Database Migration Service source connection profile ID, in the format: projects/my_project_name/locations/us-central1/connectionProfiles/connection_profile_ID

params.name: data.root_password
params.description: Input only. Initial root password.

params.name: data.root_password_set
params.description: Output only. Indicates If this connection profile root password is stored.

params.name: data.collation
params.description: The Cloud SQL default instance level collation.

methods.name: getActivationPolicy
methods.description:
The activation policy specifies when the instance is activated; it is applicable only when the instance state is 'RUNNABLE'. Valid values: 'ALWAYS': The instance is on, and remains so even in the absence of connection requests.

NEVER: The instance is off; it is not activated, even if a connection request arrives.
